Based on your preferences and cues, I would recommend watching "The Business of Strangers" (1980) directed by Alejandro Amenábar.
The movie is about a man named Tom who works as an insurance claims adjuster in the bustling city of Chicago.
Tom's job is to travel to different locations across the country, such as farms and small towns, to assess damage caused by natural disasters or other incidents.
Tom is highly skilled at his job and has built up a reputation throughout the industry as one of the most knowledgeable and skilled claims adjusters in the country.
However, Tom's world changes when he discovers that his wife, Susan, has been cheating on him with her boss, Mark.
Tom is devastated by the revelation and struggles to come to terms with what has happened.
As Tom tries to come to terms with what has happened, he finds himself struggling to make ends meet for himself and Susan, who have been forced to cut back on their living expenses in order to support themselves financially.
